key_points: A third stimulus check of up to $1,400 per person is expected as part of a $1.9 trillion Covid relief package.
The relief package was approved by the Senate and awaits President Joe Biden's signature after a final House vote.
White House press secretary Jen Psaki confirmed efforts to expedite the distribution of payments.
Approximately 90% of American households will be eligible for the payments.
Individuals earning under $75,000, and couples under $150,000, will receive the full amount, which gradually phases out for higher incomes.
Those earning over $80,000 (individuals), $120,000 (heads of households), and $160,000 (couples) will not receive payments.
Eligibility will be based on either 2019 or 2020 tax returns, depending on which is most recent.
Payment distribution may be slightly delayed due to ongoing tax filing season but will start soon after the bill's enactment.
Eligibility criteria are slightly stricter than previous rounds, potentially excluding higher income earners who previously qualified.
Taxpayers whose financial situation changed in 2020 may adjust their eligibility by filing their tax return promptly.
